judges: HON BLE MR.JUSTICE GURMEET SINGH SANDHAWALIA
respondents: Om Wati, legal representative of Pritam Singh petitioner, the dispute does not subsist any longer. Accordingly, he states that the writ petition may be dismissed as having been rendered infructuous. Ordered accordingly. .12.2012 (G.S.SANDHAWALIA) Pka JUDGE
judgment_text:
IN THE HIGH COURT OF PUNJAB AND HARYANA AT
CHANDIGARH
CWP No.8547 of 1995
Date of decision: 06.12.2012
Pritam Singh through his legal representative Om Wati Devi 
 .Petitioner
Vs.
State of Haryana and others
 .Respondents
CORAM: HON BLE MR.JUSTICE GURMEET SINGH SANDHAWALIA
*****
Present:
Mr. O.P.Hoshiarpuri, Advocate for the petitioner
Ms. Mamta Singla Talwar, Deputy Advocate General,
Haryana for the respondents.
*****
G.S.SANDHAWALIA, J.
Counsel for the petitioner states that in view of the fresh
memorandum of agreement dated 10.10.2004 between Indian Oil
Corporation and Om Wati, legal representative of Pritam Singh
petitioner, the dispute does not subsist any longer. Accordingly, he states
that the writ petition may be dismissed as having been rendered
infructuous.
Ordered accordingly.
.12.2012
 (G.S.SANDHAWALIA)
Pka
 JUDGE
